elements.description:
The px-threshold-bar is a linear multi-threshold simple bar chart used to show multiple thresholds for a single
data-source, while also showing the actual data value positioned in the overall threshold.
The user can specify as many thresholds as they want, configuring the color for each threshold.
They can also specify a unit of measure, if desired, using the `uom` property.
To show only the threshold bar with no actual value, don't set the value property.

### Usage

    <px-threshold-bar
      min="0"
      max="100"
      value="25"
      uom="%"
      config='[{"min": 0,"max": 50,"color": "red"}, {"min": 50,"max": 100,"color": "green"}]'>
    </px-threshold-bar>


### Styling
The following variables are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--px-threshold-bar-marker-color` | The color of the marker caret, line, and value | `black`
`--px-threshold-bar-scale-color` | The color of the tick lines and labels | `gray`
`--px-threshold-bar-height` | The height of the threshold bar | `10px`
`--px-threshold-bar-width` | The width of the threshold bar | `200px`
`--px-threshold-bar-line-width` | The width of the marker line  | `1px`

properties.name: min
properties.description: The minimum value for the threshold bar.

properties.name: max
properties.description: The maximum value for the threshold bar.

properties.name: hideValue
properties.description: Prevents the value from being displayed on top of the bar.

properties.name: hideScale
properties.description: Prevents the scale from being displayed below the bar.

properties.name: config
properties.description:
Configuration for the thresholds.
The value should be an array of Objects with the following structure:

    {
      "min": {Number} beginning of the threshold,
      "max": {Number} end of the threshold,
      "color": {Hex / RGB} background color for the threshold
    }

Negative values are supported, but all thresholds should be contiguous
(e.g. the max of one should be the min of the next one, with no gaps).
If thresholds are defined so narrowly that the tick label will not fit
inside the treshold, display issues may occur.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The current value to be displayed on top of the threshold bar.
If this property is null a value won't be shown but the threshold bar will still be displayed.

properties.name: uom
properties.description:
The unit of measure for the value, if any. You should use one or two characters at most,
as longer values for UOM may cause display issues.

properties.name: _scaleFactor
properties.description: Holds the (pixel / range) scale factor used to calculate the threshold bars and value positioning.

methods.name: _getStyles
methods.description: Calculates the width of the specific threshold bars.

methods.name: _scaleDataChanged
methods.description: Observer that calculates the scale factor when the extremes of the threshold bar are changed.

methods.name: _configDataChanged
methods.description: Observer that orders the threshold configuration based on the min property.

methods.name: _calculatePaddingWidth
methods.description: Calculates in pixels the padding that should be applied to all left-aligned elements

methods.name: _calculateLeftOffset
methods.description: Utility function to calculate the left offset of chart elements based on the value and scale

methods.name: _getMarkerLineStyle
methods.description: Calculates the position of the Marker Line in the threshold bar

methods.name: _getMarkerStyle
methods.description: Calculates the position of the Marker Icon in the threshold bar

methods.name: _getValueStyle
methods.description: Calculates the position of the value label in the threshold bar

methods.name: _checkValuesSet
methods.description: Verifies that values were set for the base properties min, max and value.
